message:
While i was on my way home i got such idea.

This is a project to turn the day to day system admin tasks easy to be done by any developer with a minimum experience in linux commands.

Looking for contributors too
story: Alaa Attya Mohamed shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: AlaaAttya/sys-admin-automation
caption: github.com
description: sys-admin-automation - A project to turning the day to day system admin tasks easy to be done by any developer with a minimum experience in linux commands. The project is separated into folders in the root directory. Each directory is a sysAdmin task. Each task can be implemented in various language…

data.message: انت هتخرب بيوتنا ليه :D اركن بقى
lol just trying to help non-experienced sysAdmin developers in managing their server :D
btw ana b3ml kda :D bs for the staging servers i manage it manually
Mamdouh El-Oraby شوف الحوار ده هيفيدك ولا لا يا ممدوح

@amr I've started with creating virtual host for apache2. You'll have to create a config file, update the hosts file and then enable the new vs and finally restart the server. You'll find the php script as the first task to automate suchrocess. All you need is to run sudo php script-name.php then follow the prompts you'll insert two parameters and you're done

Alaa Attya Mohamed The project idea is great, but since you need contribution to this project I could help as I have very good experience in PHP & Linux sys admin

but when I browse your project I only see single php file which could be adjustable to run from cli. but the problem if I contribute with new another file for predefined automated function to help sys admin, this mean by end of years you may got like 10-20 helper files and all are separates files which need the sys admin memorize each file features and etc ...

don't you need to build something first to centralized all future contribution ? like 1 single bash script to with help commands to run all these scripts ? also you may need php installer script to install php for servers which hasn't php installed.

Just try to put a roadmap for your project, and maybe we start creates new issues with features needed according to your roadmap and then I will be the first one ready to contribute on your project
Ashraf Kaabi I like your idea, I'll start thinking about a road map and keep you updated. I just push such script in less that two hours as it was just an idea came across my mind.
It would also be great if you make a note of some planned/suggested scripts, it could be used for requesting scripts and features as well
@kareem sure will add a road map to the read me file. So any one who aims to add any new features can send a pull request and update the file
